decks.notes: This UWx Control deck focuses on using a combination of counter spells, removal, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage through Brainstorm, Ponder, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The inclusion of cards like Magus of the Moon and Prismatic Ending allows for flexibility in handling different strategies, while Thundertrap Trainer provides additional card advantage and tempo advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board with efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will, while utilizing cards like Misty Rainforest and Scalding Tarn to fetch the necessary mana. The deck focuses on tempo and card advantage, with cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent providing threats that can quickly close out the game. Wasteland is used to disrupt opponents' mana bases, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brazen Borrower provide additional value and flexibility. The goal is to maintain pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly mill cards from the library with cards like Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor, while protecting the combo with counter spells like Force of Will. Once enough cards are milled, the player can use Dread Return to bring back a creature like Thassa's Oracle to win the game. Cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Nadu, Winged Wisdom can provide card advantage and additional protection. The deck also includes tutor effects like Urza's Saga to help find combo pieces quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom along with Nomads en-Kor and Delighted Halfling to draw through the deck, generate infinite mana, and ultimately win the game. It also includes key protection spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, along with some utility creatures like Endurance and Sylvan Safekeeper. The deck runs a mana base suited for the combo, alongside card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the combo pieces efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creature abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent, while also disrupting their game plan with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize. The deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Noble Hierarch, allowing for powerful plays early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Endurance provide additional value and resilience to the deck, making it difficult for opponents to deal with the constant threats it presents. The mana base is also designed to ensure consistency and support the deck's aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this Dimir Tempo deck is to control the board and disrupt your opponent's game plan while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. The deck aims to use efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Nethergoyf, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze, to stay ahead of the opponent while maintaining a strong tempo. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and helps dig for key cards, while the Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent offer threats that can quickly close out the game. The mana base is built to support the deck's overall strategy and ensure consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures that disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Eldrazi Linebreaker and Reality Smasher while using cards like Chalice of the Void to control the game. The deck also includes powerful colorless lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple to help cast the Eldrazi creatures quickly. Overall, the strategy is to apply pressure early in the game and disrupt the opponent's plays with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing Mystic Forge in combination with artifacts like Voltaic Key and Basalt Monolith to generate an infinite mana combo. The goal is to cast powerful cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Saga quickly to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Candelabra of Tawnos and Defense Grid helps to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck aims to create a fast and resilient board state to win the game efficiently through a powerful artifact-based strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt opponents' mana bases with cards like Magus of the Moon and Blood Moon, while quickly ramping up to play powerful dragons like Fury and Pyrogoyf. The deck uses cards like Ancient Tomb, Chrome Mox, and Simian Spirit Guide to accelerate its game plan, while also utilizing The One Ring to provide additional aggression. Additionally, Sundering Eruption and Shatterskull Smashing provide removal and reach, making this deck a formidable aggro force in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on utilizing various control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card advantage to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also incorporates a ramp component to quickly develop mana and play powerful threats like Murktide Regent. The deck aims to establish dominance through efficient card selection, disruption, and powerful creatures to outlast the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Cephalid Illusionist with Nomads en-Kor to mill through the library, getting Narcomoebas in the graveyard and eventually winning the game by casting Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes various disruption and protection spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, as well as card selection with Ponder and Brainstorm. Urza's Saga and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide additional value and utility. The deck aims to combo off quickly and efficiently while also being able to interact with the opponent's game plan.

This Legacy deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of disruptive spells like Daze and Thoughtseize, while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent to apply pressure. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to deal with opposing threats. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells and removal, the deck aims to control the game early and maintain an advantage throughout the match. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to provide card advantage and keep the opponent off balance.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures, disrupting the opponent with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Eldrazi Linebreaker. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration from cards like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal to cast its high-cost threats ahead of schedule. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Wastescape+Battlemage','','');">Wastescape Battlemage to control the opponent's resources and restrict their options.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Mystic Forge and various key artifacts to generate infinite mana and card advantage. By combining cards like Karn, the Great Creator, Grim Monolith, and Voltaic Key, players can quickly ramp into dangerous threats like Ugin, the Eye of the Storms and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain. The deck aims to lock opponents out of the game while assembling its powerful combo pieces to achieve victory efficiently and effectively. The strategy revolves around artifact synergy and mana acceleration to overwhelm opponents in the Legacy format.

This deck focuses on fast aggression, utilizing creatures like Amped Raptor and Orcish Bowmasters to quickly establish board presence. It also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes cards like Swords to Plowshares and Static Prison to control the board and protect its creatures. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride provide additional support and buff creatures for added aggression. The mana base includes lands that can produce multiple colors and utility lands like Wasteland for added flexibility.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on early aggression and disruption, utilizing cheap spells to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counter spells and land destruction. The deck aims to control the board and tempo, using cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent to apply pressure while spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle disrupt the opponent's plays. The deck also includes efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to deal with threats. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent while disrupting their strategy.
